summary:
Using my solid background as Senior Project Manager / Producer in the field of (digital) media, software, events and marketing to drive value creation and transparency in Global Procurement. 

I have always been focused on innovation and trends within the marketing and media landscape. Working with a large variety of stakeholders, I keep a strong focus on managing expectations, ensuring deadlines are met within budget and maintaining an overview of strategic goals. 

Used to working with media and marketing directors, account managers, advertising & media agencies and A-list brands. I managed international multidisciplinary project teams consisting of creatives, 2D motion graphic artists, 3D artists, (multimedia) programmers. I am used to working in an Agile environment. 

This experience made me solution oriented and able to see opportunities instead of problems. 
In my past roles I have grown with companies from start-up to scale-up. Due to the nature of start-ups, I have been involved in projects from start to finish. From identifying the scope, writing proposals and tender bids to briefing and assigning work to internal resources and external production vendors. This experience gives me an advantage in successfully negotiating with external partners and the ability to recognize potential risks. 

I am a digital native with an analogue heart and a strong interest in all that technology and multimedia have to offer. I love a challenge and I always aim for personal development and professional growth. 

I have executed projects both nationally and internationally, mostly throughout Europe, North America and Asia. Brands I have worked for on projects include BMW, Sony, Ford, Samsung, Volvo, Toshiba, Philips, Mercedes, UNESCO, PLUS Supermarkets, Heineken, Becel and Flora. 

Advertising and media agencies I have worked with include Saatchi & Saatchi, Omnicom, Publicis, Starcom, Ogilvy, Wieden + Kennedy, Mullenlowe, Grey Worldwide, Cheil, OMD, Imagination and TBWA.

projects.title: DS Group New Delhi 3D video mapping projection
projects.description:
New Delhi - On March 8th 2014, NuFormer has successfully executed a 3D video mapping projection for the book presentation and inaugural event of the new Dharampal Satyapal Group headquarters. The projection covered all 7 facades totalling to an impressive 180 meters (590 feet) wide which makes it the widest projection mapping ever executed in Asia. During the festivities the guests were surprised with the enormous 3D video mapping projection which took them on a journey through a number of the DS Group's products and processes. Afterwards the grand finale made the building go wild.

Script and storyboard design by NuFormer in close cooperation with Showtime Events and the DS Group. Creative content production and audio by NuFormer. Technical execution by Dynamix Media.

contributors.headline: Digital artist with pixels and code

projects.title: Philips Amsterdam 3D video mapping projection
projects.description:
Amsterdam, November 13, 2013. As part of its new brand positioning campaign Philips revealed their new logo to all its employees and press worldwide with a spectacular 3D video mapping show projected on the massive façade of the headquarter building. The mapping projection was produced and performed by NuFormer. The reveal in Amsterdam was streamed live and virtually attended by between 20.000 and 30.000 Philips employees worldwide. Some hours after the reveal show in Amsterdam NuFormer performed the same projection, although somewhat modified for the Brazilian market, in São Paulo, Brazil.

Before and after the big reveal Philips’ employees and other attendees were able to interact via Kinect with several staple Philips products and the building. And there is no better way than an interactive 3D video mapping to bring the brand line “innovation and you” to life!

projects.title: Dolfinarium Harderwijk 3D video mapping projection
projects.description: After an extensive renovation the Dolfinarium in Harderwijk, The Netherlands opened her doors again for the general public on April 27th 2013. In close cooperation with the Jora Vision and Dolfinarium team, NuFormer produced the 3D video mapping animations for the new Aqua Bella show. The upcoming three years the Aqua Bella show will take the visitors of the Dolfinarium onto a journey around the world and will display the beauty but also the vulnerability of the earth. Displaying different continents was the main reason why a traditional fixed piece of scenery was not an option. The animations are projected onto a tailor-made decor, designed by NuFormer. The decor consists of multiple big screens that, put together, make up a big abstract tail. By means of 3D video mapping the screen is transformed into beautiful landscapes that alternate with the dolphin behaviors. The DolfijndoMijn is one of the first theaters worldwide to incorporate this technique into their show.

contributors.headline: Key Account Manager Telecom & Technology bij Brunel

projects.title: Starbucks Mumbai 3D video mapping projection
projects.description:
More than 20,000 shops in the world and not one of them in India. Until the 19th of October 2012, the day that Starbucks, in a joint venture with Tata Global Beverages, opened her first shop in Mumbai. This festive event was reinforced by an impressive video mapping projection on the Elphinstone Building, the place where the first Indian Starbucks coffee shop is housed.

The script and storyboard for this production were established in close cooperation with the clients. The projection on the 40 meter wide building formed a challenge because of the short distance between the façade and the public. Therefore the viewing angles were an important element in the content production process to make sure that the 8 minute mapping projection could be viewed well by all attending VIPs. And it worked out fine. Again a video mapping projection was the successful culmination of a very special event.

projects.title: Mercedes-Benz Chengdu Motor Show (CDMS) interactive car projection
projects.description: Chengdu – On August 30, 2012, the day before the Chengdu Motor Show (CDMS) in China, NuFormer performed another impressive interactive 3D video mapping projection. The interactive projection installation surprised guests as they were attending the introductory event of the new Mercedes-Benz B-Class. NuFormer proved again to continue the upward trend of innovations.

contributors.headline: 3D Generalist, Video Editor, Motion Designer, VFX Artist

projects.title: Heineken Munich 3D video mapping projection
projects.description:
The night prior to the UEFA Champions League final, NuFormer performed another impressive 3D video mapping projection in Munich, Germany during the Heineken VIP event. In the complete darkness, the façade of the Schleissheim Palace turned into a massive canvas for NuFormer’s video mapping that showed striking video footage from the last played Champions League games and all its famous players. Gradually the show expanded to enlighten the full 60-meter width of the façade. The 3D video mapping projection ended with a blast of ‘superlative’ animations and Champions League peak moments to prepare the crowd for what was still to come the following night during the final game. The guests had to be wowed and surprised until the very end and it was the talk of the evening and the start of the pre-match excitement for the special guests.

Most of the video footage was shot during games played in the same tournament just weeks and in some cases days prior to the event and therefore supplied to NuFormer very shortly before the video mapping projection had to take place. This last-minute merge of 3D artwork as well as the editing of the footage was a real challenge due to the time constraint.

Creative content production by NuFormer. Script and storyboard design by NuFormer, in close cooperation with TWBA/United State of Fans. Technical production by CT Holland

projects.title: Mocap Mapping
projects.description:
NuFormer presents Mocap Mapping, a first of its kind combination of 3D video mapping projection and live motion capture technology. This brand-new mix allows for engaging interaction between the audience and a 3D character (accomplished by giving the actor in the motion capture suit a live video and audio feed of the audience) projected onto a building. I had the pleasure to work on the project management and production for the execution of the event. 

For this production NuFormer joined forces with motion capture specialist Motek Entertainment. The technical production was a collaboration between NuFormer, Motek and Creative Technology Holland. Music by Studio Rockfish. 

Links:
The making-of: vimeo.com/39409273 
Full version (20 min.): vimeo.com/39056295

Mocap Mapping was shortlisted at the 2012 Tomorrow Awards

projects.title: Ford NAIAS Detroit 360 degree projection
projects.description:
A trip into “the Cloud” was one of the highlights at the North American International Auto Show 2012 in Detroit. Located in the very heart of the Ford booth, a twenty-foot-tall elevator took attendees straight through the ceiling of the hall into “the Cloud”. Up there, a 360-degree seamless projection by NuFormer showcased Ford’s future of in-vehicle technology. The projection content was a vivid and advanced combination of 3D animations and 2D motion graphics. After the 3 minute film the lift serviced people back to the ground and it was clear: Ford showed off its strive for innovation and forward thinking with their “Living Connected Experience”, the largest stand at this renowned exhibition.

Script and storyboard design in cooperation with Imagination. Creative content production by NuFormer. Technical production by Imagination and Creative Technology US.

contributors.headline: 3D Generalist, Video Editor, Motion Designer, VFX Artist

projects.title: BMW Madrid 3D video mapping projection
projects.description:
On September 15, NuFormer Projection completed its third successful 3D video mapping in Madrid, Spain. The projection marked the launch of the new BMW Series 1. The lively Santa Ana square formed the centre stage of the action-packed projection, revealing the two new BMW models on the façade of the Teatro Español.

The hundreds of people that witnessed the festive event responded highly enthusiastic after having seen the fast-paced animation topped with spectacular sound effects. In between the screenings, the audience was given an active role by projecting their first reactions posted on social media platforms onto the theatre.

Script production in collaboration with Posterscope, CARAT and SCPF. Storyboard and content production by NuFormer. Interactive content by third party. Technical production by CT Holland/JVR

This production was a 2011 EMEA InAvation Awards finalist.

contributors.headline: 3D Generalist, Video Editor, Motion Designer, VFX Artist

projects.title: TUMO Yerevan 3D video mapping projection
projects.description:
A spectacular NuFormer 3D video mapping projection, on show every day during the festivities, formed one of the highlights of the celebrations around the opening of the TUMO Center for Creative Technologies in Yerevan Armenia, aimed at introducing teenagers to the creative digital arts.

Credits
Script, storyboard and creative content production by NuFormer. The complex hardware transport was a joint effort of NuFormer and Creative Technology Holland. Technical production by Creative Technology Holland.

projects.title: 2K Games E3 Los Angeles content for custom shaped LED booth
projects.description:
From June 7-9, 2011 the annual video game conference and show E3 (Electronic Entertainment Expo) took place at the Los Angeles Convention Center. For this years booth at E3 NuFormer, 2K Games and Creative Technology US teamed up to create some spectacular LED walls at the 2K E3 booth.

This project is not a projection on a building or object as you would expect from NuFormer. This time NuFormer created top level LED content between the game trailers 2K showed presenting their new games. High standard 3D animations were used to create smooth, game inspired and uniform transitions from one trailer to the other.

contributors.headline: 3D Generalist, Video Editor, Motion Designer, VFX Artist
Senior Account Director at Creative Technology/NEP Live Events

projects.title: Journey to the West Xi'an 3D video mapping projection
projects.description:
This video gives a sneak preview of the projection content for a permanent video mapping projection setup in China. At this moment the NuFormer team is creating the last part of the content. Also they prepare the full production for final and permanent setup and execution.

The video mapping content will be projected on the Wild Goose Pagoda in the city of Xi’an, the ancient capital of China. This projection, that will as expected draw many people to the city in the near future, will be officially launched in spring of this year. Please follow our social media platforms to keep updated about this.

The video mapping projection is based on one of the four great classical novels of Chinese literature, titled ‘Journey to the West’. The novel is a fictionalized account of the legendary pilgrimage to India of a Buddhist monk who eventually returned and brought back and introduced Buddhism to China.

For this cultural project NuFormer cooperates with the Chinese and Beijing based company Dream Lighting. This collaboration resulted in a refined script, an extended storyboard and advanced film recording for chromakey on location in Beijing. In this studio the monk and the horse were filmed. NuFormer did the direction of actors and the organization of crew and facilities during the shootings. Dream Lighting arranged the studio facilities and the 80 hands studio crew that worked hard to have all the shots recorded in three days. 

The film footage was edited and post-produced in the NuFormer studio in The Netherlands. Also the 2D and 3D design and creation as well as the final composition was done in the NuFormer studio by the NuFormer creative team. 

The music for the production has been composed by one of China’s most famous composers and played by his dedicated musicians. Mostly tradional instruments were used and in close communication with NuFormer the music score was based on every separate scene and related emotions.

projects.title: Toshiba Berlin 3D video mapping projection
projects.description: The IFA fair in Berlin is the world's biggest and most important trade show for consumer electronics and home appliances. For our client Grey Worldwide NuFormer developed its first official indoor 3D mapping projection onto two big white objects in the Toshiba hall of this 50th IFA fair. From September 3-8, 2010 the visitors were blown away by the projection which added an extra dimension to the Toshiba hall. We projected onto two big boxes and their surfaces as well as the objects that were standing inside these boxes.

projects.title: BMW Singapore 3D video mapping projection
projects.description:
This particular 3D projection was done on two identical, adjacent buildings of Sun Tec City in Singapore. The projections were quite large and fitted with matching audio.

The entire projection consisted of 3D animation, based on the style and video footage of the latest BMW TV commercials developed by Publicis. The projection took place on two consecutive nights and were part of a special event for the top executives of BMW Asia and their business associates.

Implementation: May 5 and 6, 2010
Story board: Publicis
Design: Publicis/NuFormer

projects.title: Sony Madrid (Colegio San Augustin) 3D video mapping projection
projects.description:
Immediately after the finals of the UEFA Champions League, Madrid had the scoop of two 3D projections. Commissioned by Sony, NuFormer developed two beautiful projections on two different buildings on two different locations in Madrid. The 3D projections turned the façades of the buildings into two giant pinball machines in which soccer played a central role.

The theatre at the Plaza Santa Ana on a busy square in the middle of the city centre and the Colegio San Augustin, were the two buildings chosen for the projections. At this last location opposite the Bernabeu Stadium a VIP party was held. The 3D projection was shown there to a particular group of approximately 1500 people.

For both projections the central theme was 'Imagine Football in 3D'. In order to design these projections NuFormer used advanced chromakey technique. The 3D content and animations were of outstanding quality.

Other activities included:

profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
As a Project Manager at NuFormer I worked closely with creative teams, clients, technical engineers, (advertising) agencies, account managers and (event) producers to manage expectations, guide project teams towards final deliverables and maintain a helicopter view over all project related components. Involved from acquisition to management during execution of media, digital and on site of brand activations, product launches and large scale events.

Role included:
- Transitioning from a local animation production house into a worldwide player in designing and developing innovative digital multimedia. 
- Working on projects for UEFA finals, international car shows, conventions and product launches. 
- Writing proposals, tender bids, statements of work and requests for change. - Development of internal best practices and project methodologies: start-up to scale-up.
